definition: to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate

sentences.english: If the husband or the wife dies, may the other marry again?
sentences.chinese: 夫婦二人中死了一個，單夫寡婦還能婚配麼？

sentences.english: Garou Shall Not Mate with Garou.
They were in love, but getting married was complicated.
sentences.chinese: 他們相親相愛，但是談婚配嫁娶可沒那麼簡單。

sentences.english: Can the Church give a dispensation from these impediments?
sentences.chinese: 聖教會能寬免婚配的阻礙麼？

sentences.english: He said the portrayal of the penguins' mating rituals as a love story is a "major" case of anthropomorphism.
sentences.chinese: 他說電影中的婚配儀式純粹是藝術化的擬人。

sentences.english: The problem of the older youths marriage has become an important research area.
sentences.chinese: 大齡青年的婚配問題成爲社會學研究的一個重要領域。

sentences.english: What is the meaning of the Nuptial Blessing at Mass?
sentences.chinese: 彌撒中降福婚配，是什麼意思？

definition: to take a wife/to get married (man)
to betroth a girl (in arranged marriages)
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
